review_blob: smooth, creamy, roasty and thick

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: perfect corona knockoff.  light, crisp and drinkable (no skunky aroma at least) but extremely boring
crisp and malty, vaguely belgian, but something lacking
beer_name: Pizza Port Ale Nino Old Ale

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: a simple middle of the road IPA
fruity, mainly from dried cranberries, and blessed with a floral/spicy aroma.  very Belgian in character, warming and unique
full, rich and alcoholic; these flavors were none the less tempered with pleasant and abundant spicing
crisp, spicy and full of citrusy flavors
very agressive smokey nose, it was a little sweeter on the palate than expected.  in bottled form a few months later, this beer seemed well rounded, balanced and easier to drink
beer_name: Pizza Port Smokey The Rye Beer

review_blob: a very nice, lighter colored barleywine.  seems to vary vastly from batch to batch, but after the initial oversweet, syrupy hoppiness goes away, a very good beer
a huge old ale, loaded with huge caramel/toffee/chocolate flavors.  creamy, rich and full bodied, an excellent fireside beer
a very drinkable barleywine that seems to get better with age.  can be a little agressive when young, but patience is rewarded
a very good, easy to drink, unassuming red ale
beer_name: Pizza Port Shark Bite Red Ale

review_blob: simple and crisp, with a hint of spiciness
beer_name: Pizza Port Carlsbad Chronic Amber Ale (-2011)

review_blob: highly hopped pale ale, with a very nice mouthfeel and drinkability
dark black; creamy and smooth, with just a bit of coffee flavor
one of my favorite pale ales.  very nice maltiness is highlighted by an incredible hop aroma and flavor.
beer_name: Pizza Port Ponto Sessionable India Pale Ale

review_blob: one of my favorite pale ales.  very nice maltiness is highlighted by an incredible hop aroma and flavor.
simple and sweet, with nothing worth recommending
a pleasant, crisp middle of the road export style lager
very inviting fresh hop aroma is immediately noticed.  on the palate, although the hops are still dominant, this one evened out a bit.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Wet Hop IPA - Northern Hemisphere

review_blob: very nice malty beer, with an easy drinkability.  nutty and crisp, with a bit of hops
kind of gets lost in the shuffle when compared to the celebration and harvest ales.  this beer is quite good however, with a more restrained hoppiness and a nicer hop/malt balance.
rather unremarkable in any way, although it was crisp and refreshing at the time
good solid beer, with no remarkable characteristics
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Pale Bock

review_blob: incredible.  although it varies from year to year, this beer is consistently awesome.  when fresh, the hops leap from the glass, inviting the drinker in, only to experience the rich, sweet malty backbone of this beer, which is highlighted by a citric hop flavor and a drying, warming alcoholic finish.  in aged versions, the abundant hoppiness is replaced by a more restrained toffee like maltiness.  excellent either way
a good crisp summer pilsner, with the barest hint of citrus
crisp and uninspiring.  a simple wheat beer, when I was expecting so much more
a very good black beer, with a nice mix of roasty chocolate malt and citrusy northwest hops.

a nearly perfect beer.  beautiful copper color, the beer sparkles invitingly.  a light, fluffy off white ahead rests on top.  crisp and refreshing, with a nutty flavor, with perfectly balanced hops.  one of the best beers to be found anywhere
a spiced triple, with notes of pepper, coriander and citrus
much like the X, never quite lives up to the promise of its beautiful nose.  good, but could have been great

outstanding!!!  huge, with tons of coffee/espresso both in the nose and on the palate.  pitch black in color, with a minimal head and low carbonation.  smooth, with dark chocolate and loads of alcohol.  very, very good
very good belgian quencher/session beer.  spicy, tangy beer, with hints of lemon and a bit of alcohol
a pleasant drink for a hot afternoon, one whose quality varies from sample to sample depending on the surrounding conditions and circumstances
a very good beer, one which only becomes better served on cask.  nicely balanced, with good toasty/biscuity malt balanced joyfully by fruity hops.
a decent easy drinking beer; nothing more, nothing less
a very nice, filling, nutty, chocolatey brown ale.  low in alcohol, a perfect companion for a long evening out
beer_name: AleSmith Nut Brown English-Style Ale (Bottle and Draft)

review_blob: a very nice christmas present, finally bottled last year for the first time (although the growlers made thanksgiving dinner so much more fun)  rich and malty, with a nice filling mouthfeel.  well balanced, with a perfect amount of hops and a long warming finish.
very, very nice.  nice sweetness, balanced beautifully by pleasant citrusy hops (especially brilliant when served cask conditioned and dry hopped)
a very nice porter, especially when served from the cask, which really allows the hops to blend nicely with the smoky, roasted malt.
very nice.  sweet, caramel/toffee/nutty flavors predominate, eventually leading to a nice, somewhat dry finish
incredible nose, but the beer never quite lives up to its initial promise.  good, but...
sweet, and somewhat tart.  when tasted on draft the beer was quite woody, and very memorable
thick, with beautiful carmel/toffee flavors and a pleasant note of alcohol at the end.  one of the better beers to come out of san diego
Outstanding belgian style beer.  crisp, sour, rich, spicy, sweet...hard to define but easy to drink
very nice belgian strong ale.  crisp, spicy and very easy to drink

amazing!!!  3rd try at this beer and stone has finally hit it right on the head.  the finest imperial stout i have encountered.  pours thick, oily and inky black, with minimal carbonation.  although there are flavors of dark chocolate, espresso and maybe a bit of port and dark fruit mixed in, the dominant flavor is of black licorice, which dominates not only the nose, but the palate as well.  rich, chewy and warming, this beer envelopes the drinker, never letting up, even as the flavors linger away, leaving the drinker relaxed and content
doesnt quite live up to the hype.  a decent, but amped up, belgian style white, this one hardly seems like a candidate for long term aging.
the best of the anniversary IPAs.  hops seem a little more restrained, and the overall effect is not as syrupy (maybe due to the drying effect of the alcohol being more noticeable).
